body: @rhtyd can you investigate why the fix for this issue in 4.5 does not appear to be pulled forward?  For traceability purposes, it would be preferable to forward merge the fix than commit a new version of it.

Syed Ahmed  on dev@cloudstack.apache.org replies:
I'll take a look at this. It's been some moths but afaik I added that
extension because previously that code wasn't working. I'll take a look in
detail and let you guys know
@blueorangutan package
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.

@rhtyd @jburwell 

I think the fix for CLOUDSTACK-9376 will not address below scenario. I will test this and confirm. 

1. templatefilter=all or isofilter=all is applicable only to admin
and domain admin.
2. With templatefilter=all or isofilter=all below are the visiblity
of templates in system.
a. admin should be able to see all templates/iso in system.
b. domain admin should be able to see all public template and
templates under its domain tree (including sub domain).
c. domain admin in a project context should be able to see all public
 templates and templates registered as project account and templates
 which are shared(using updateTemplatePermission api) with project account.
Thanks @jburwell I'll get this re-tested against both Travis and Trillian.
Packaging result: ✔centos6 ✔centos7 ✔debian. JID-300
Packaging result: ✔centos6 ✔centos7 ✔debian. JID-301
@murali-reddy @rhtyd can you investigate the Travis failures?
@blueorangutan test matrix
@blueorangutan test
@rhtyd a Trillian-Jenkins test job (centos7 mgmt + kvm-centos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests
@jburwell a Trillian-Jenkins matrix job (centos6 mgmt + xs65sp1, centos7 mgmt + vmware55u3, centos7 mgmt + kvmcentos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests

@jburwell the issue was with an intermittent test that sometimes fail when clocks get skewed in virtualized environment: `  HypervisorUtilsTest.checkVolumeFileForActivityTest:68 Didn't block long enough, expected at least 2000 and got 1003`. I'll try to fix this in a separate PR.

Since, changes are all in integration test specific code. We can merge this once it passes, based on the last runs, the failure with private gw is not seen.
LGTM. Travis failure was due to an intermittent issue with oobm test, which has been fixed now.
@abhinandanprateek @murali-reddy @jburwell this may be useful for 4.9/lts, would you like to review?
@abhinandanprateek could you please rebase this PR to pick up the fixes to the broken tests?  I want to make sure that this PR doesn't introduce any side-effects that break the test runs.
Coupled with @rhtyd's explanation, we will merge this PR if the current blueorganutan run comes up clean.
